required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultra Low Dose CT for CACS and AC of SPECT
clinical_study.official_title: Usefulness of Ultra Low Dose Cardiac CT for Coronary Calcium Scoring and for Attenuation Correction of SPECT

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to compare the CACS obtained from standard dose CT to the CACS obtained from ultra-low-dose scans. Additionally, the usefulness of ultra-low-dose CT for AC of myocardial perfusion SPECT will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Agreement and Correlation of Coronary Artery Calcium Score Obtained From Ultra-low-dose and Standard CT
primary_outcome.description: CAC and BA limits of agreement between coronary artery calcium score obtained from ultra-low-dose and standard CT. Coronary artery calcium (CAC) is a measure for quantification of coronary artery calcification based on non-contrast enhanced CT, ranging from 0 (no calcifications) to infinite. It is an arbitrary unit. Increasing CAC means higher amounts of coronary artery calcifications and is associated with worse prognosis. Bland-Altman (BA) analysis is a statistical method to compare two modalities or techniques assessing the same measure. Limits of agreement is defined as +/- twice the standard deviation of the differences between the reference method and the new modality/technique. Broader limits of agreement mean less accurate results obtained by the new modality/techniqe, while a 0 BA limit of agreement would theoretically reflect perfect agreement.

primary_outcome.measure: Intra-class Correlation Coefficient Between Segmental Relative Tracer Uptake From SPECT Datasets Reconstructed With AC Maps Based on Ultra-Low-Dose and Standard Dose CT
primary_outcome.description: For every patient, the CT images from 120 and 70 kVp-CT scans were used to create CTAC maps which were then used to reconstruct SPECT images, displayed as a 17-segment model polar plot with normalized percent tracer uptake given for every segment. Intra-class correlation was then applied to compare segmental relative tracer uptake. Analysis and the resulting correlation coefficient of 0.987 basically demonstrates interchangeability between the two datasets.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard dose CT, Ultra-low dose CT
arm_group.description: Standard dose non-contrast enhanced CT (clinically indicated) and Ultra low dose non-contrast enhanced CT (as part of the trial)

intervention.intervention_name: Ultra low dose non-contrast enhanced CT
intervention.description: Non-contrast enhanced CT for CACS and AC using a novel protocol for ultra low dose radiation dose exposure
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard dose CT, Ultra-low dose CT

intervention.description: Clinically indicated non-contrast enhanced CT for CACS and AC according to routine protocol
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard dose CT, Ultra-low dose CT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients referred for myocardial perfusion SPECT
- Male and Female subjects â‰¥18 years of age,
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy or breast-feeding
- CACS of 0 after inclusion of 10 patients with CACS 0
- Stents or implanted cardiac devices (valves, pace makers, ICD)
- Coronary artery bypass grafts

facility.name: Department of Nuclear Medicine, University Hospital Zurich

group.title: Standard Dose CT, Ultra-low Dose CT
group.description: Standard dose and ultra-low dose non-contrast enhanced CT Standard dose non-contrast enhanced CT: Clinically indicated non-contrast enhanced CT for CACS and AC according to routine protocol Ultra-low dose non-contrast enhanced CT: Additional scan as part of the trial

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Agreement and Correlation of Coronary Artery Calcium Score Obtained From Ultra-low-dose and Standard CT
outcome.description: CAC and BA limits of agreement between coronary artery calcium score obtained from ultra-low-dose and standard CT. Coronary artery calcium (CAC) is a measure for quantification of coronary artery calcification based on non-contrast enhanced CT, ranging from 0 (no calcifications) to infinite. It is an arbitrary unit. Increasing CAC means higher amounts of coronary artery calcifications and is associated with worse prognosis. Bland-Altman (BA) analysis is a statistical method to compare two modalities or techniques assessing the same measure. Limits of agreement is defined as +/- twice the standard deviation of the differences between the reference method and the new modality/technique. Broader limits of agreement mean less accurate results obtained by the new modality/techniqe, while a 0 BA limit of agreement would theoretically reflect perfect agreement.
outcome.population: 2/105 participants were not analyzed due to corrupt datasets.

measure.title: Agreement and Correlation of Coronary Artery Calcium Score Obtained From Ultra-low-dose and Standard CT
measure.description: CAC and BA limits of agreement between coronary artery calcium score obtained from ultra-low-dose and standard CT. Coronary artery calcium (CAC) is a measure for quantification of coronary artery calcification based on non-contrast enhanced CT, ranging from 0 (no calcifications) to infinite. It is an arbitrary unit. Increasing CAC means higher amounts of coronary artery calcifications and is associated with worse prognosis. Bland-Altman (BA) analysis is a statistical method to compare two modalities or techniques assessing the same measure. Limits of agreement is defined as +/- twice the standard deviation of the differences between the reference method and the new modality/technique. Broader limits of agreement mean less accurate results obtained by the new modality/techniqe, while a 0 BA limit of agreement would theoretically reflect perfect agreement.

outcome.title: Intra-class Correlation Coefficient Between Segmental Relative Tracer Uptake From SPECT Datasets Reconstructed With AC Maps Based on Ultra-Low-Dose and Standard Dose CT
outcome.description: For every patient, the CT images from 120 and 70 kVp-CT scans were used to create CTAC maps which were then used to reconstruct SPECT images, displayed as a 17-segment model polar plot with normalized percent tracer uptake given for every segment. Intra-class correlation was then applied to compare segmental relative tracer uptake. Analysis and the resulting correlation coefficient of 0.987 basically demonstrates interchangeability between the two datasets.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
